instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4652 fuse question?
threads.message:
Hey guys i got one of these iMac's fuse is blown. no schematics.

Just want to know would these work same as macbook pro f9700 fuse>???

threads.title: 820-4652 fuse question?
threads.message: i know the 27" 2012 uses 3A 120 ohms ferrite bead instead of a fuse. The 21" imac uses 3A fuse which is same as the MacBook Pro. if the package looks like a fuse then replace with a fuse then otherwise a ferrite bead.

threads.title: 820-4652 fuse question?
threads.message: thanks looks exactly the same. Usually they have a p on it this one got n? i checked i got a same year imac in 21" which also look the same.

threads.title: 820-4652 fuse question?
threads.message: If you see p or n then its a fuse. Use 3 amp fuse.

threads.title: 820-4652 fuse question?
threads.message: yep slapped it on all working :)
